feed.title: NewsTracker: boko haram
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Amnesty slams Nigeria army for abuses in Boko Haram battle
entry.summary:
Boko Haram has been fighting to impose Islamic Law across Nigeria's north for the last six years, massacring civilians and kidnapping thousands of women and children, but Amnesty alleges that the military's response has resulted in further atrocities against civilians.

During their campaign against Boko Haram, the Nigerian military detained more than 20,000 people - often on scant evidence - and then held them in brutal conditions that resulted in many deaths, alleged the report.

entry.title: Amnesty slams Nigeria army for abuses in Boko Haram battle
41 people killed by Boko Haram in Nigerian election
entry.summary: Boko Haram extremists killed 41 people, including a legislator, and scared hundreds of people from polling stations in the northeastern Nigeria.

entry.title: Boko Haram refugees suffer "dramatic" conditions in east Niger: UN source
entry.summary: Around 25,000 Niger nationals who fled islands in Lake Chad over fears of attack from the Boko Haram jihadist group are living in "dramatic" conditions on the mainland, a UN source said Wednesday.

entry.title: Boko Haram Attack on Northern Nigerian City Kills 20
entry.summary: Boko Haram once again attacked the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri on Tuesday, waking residents with deafening explosions in the early hours of the morning and then a suicide bombing that witnesses said killed as many as 20 people.

entry.title: Boko Haram attack on northern Nigerian city kills 20
entry.summary: Over the weekend, more than 30 people died in another Boko Haram assault involving another suicide bombing and rocket-propelled grenades.

entry.title: Boko Haram video allegedly shows militants killing soldiers
entry.summary: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria (AP) - A new Boko Haram video allegedly shows a militant shooting wounded soldiers in the head, and charred parts claimed to be the remnants of a downed Nigerian jet fighter.

entry.title: Children rescued from Boko Haram so traumatised they have forgotten their names
entry.summary:
Nigerian girls who fled Boko Haram to Chad gather in a school set up by UNICEF at the Baga Sola refugee camp.

Nairobi, Kenya: After years in a Boko Haram camp, the children had forgotten their native language.

They had been rescued by the country's military in November from a squalid Boko Haram encampment near the border with Nigeria.

Boko Haram is now under siege by Nigerian and other African troops.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks northeast city again, jet fighter deploys
entry.summary: Hit-and-run attacks on villages and bombings are also continuing, weeks after the military announced that a multinational offensive had forced Boko Haram from the towns and villages where it had declared "an Islamic caliphate."

entry.title: Boko Haram again attacks northeast Nigerian city Maiduguri,
entry.summary: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria - Witnesses say Boko Haram is again attacking the northeastern city of Maiduguri where explosions, heavy gunfire and the screech of a jet fighter were heard around midnight.

entry.title: Nigeria's new president to visit Chad, Niger on 1st trip; all nations fighting Boko Haram
entry.summary:
LAGOS, Nigeria - Nigeria's new president will visit Chad and Niger, making the countries whose troops help fight Boko Haram a priority on his first official travels outside the country, an official said Monday.

Battle-hardened Chadian troops have had to retake some towns from Boko Haram several times because Nigerian troops haven't arrived to secure them.

Nigeria's military has said the offensive has cut Boko Haram's supply lines across borders and that the militants' main fighting force is hemmed into a northeastern forest stronghold.

entry.title: Boko Haram raids two Nigeria towns
entry.summary:
Boko Haram radicals also attacked Galda, 20 kilometres (12 miles) from Fika, at around 8 pm (1900 GMT).

"Fika and Galda came under attack from Boko Haram last night. They burnt several public buildings in Fika and looted shops in Galda,"he said, asking not to be named because he was not authorised to speak to the media.

entry.title: Nigerian army repels Boko Haram as new president starts term
entry.summary:
It was not clear if Boko Haram's fresh assault on the strategically crucial city was timed to coincide with the inauguration.

Mr Buhari in his inaugural speech noted the successes of the four-nation offensive but said Boko Haram would not be defeated until operational command was shifted from the capital Abuja to Maiduguri.

entry.title: Suicide bomber, RPGs kill 30 in Nigerian birthplace of Boko Haram
entry.summary:
An intelligence officer said Boko Haram was firing the rocket-propelled grenades.

Buhari said he will move the headquarters for the war against Boko Haram from Abuja, the capital in central Nigeria, to Maiduguri.

entry.title: Nigerian troops repel Boko Haram attack on Maiduguri
entry.summary: Experts doubt that Boko Haram currently has the capacity to seize Maiduguri, but a major attack inside the city could still be disastrous for civilians.

entry.title: Nigeria military repels Boko Haram attack in northeast
entry.summary: Nigeria's military on Saturday repelled a Boko Haram attack on the key northeast city of Maiduguri that saw rocket-propelled grenades fired into homes, witnesses and security sources said.

entry.title: Nigeria's new president pledges fight against Boko Haram
entry.summary:
Nigeria also confronts the most deadly conflict on the continent - the insurgency by Boko Haram that has killed more than 13,000 people and driven more than 1.5 million from their homes.

"But we cannot claim to have defeated Boko Haram without rescuing the Chibok girls and all other innocent persons held hostage by insurgents," he said, referring to the hundreds of girls seized more than a year ago from their school in Chibok in northeastern Borno state.

entry.title: Nigeria's new president pledges fight against Boko Haram
entry.summary: Nigeria's military is accused of killing detainees and civilians and burning their homes in revenge for Boko Haram attacks.

entry.title: Cameroon food stocks dwindle as Boko Haram violence disrupts farming
entry.summary: Boko Haram fighters seized control of a swathe of northeast Nigeria last year, killing thousands in an unprecedented land grab while increasing incursions into neighbouring countries, including Cameroon.

entry.title: Cameroon food stocks dwindle as Boko Haram violence disrupts farming
entry.summary: Though a military campaign by Nigeria backed by its neighbors Chad, Niger and Cameroon has driven Boko Haram out of many positions it previously held, the U.N. still expects refugee numbers to rise.

entry.title: Muhammadu Buhari takes over Nigeria in crisis
entry.summary: Buhari thanked the leaders of neighboring Cameroon, Chad and Niger for contributing to a multinational offensive that this year has driven Boko Haram from towns where it had declared an Islamic caliphate.

entry.title: Boko Haram clash 'kills 4 Chad soldiers, 33 Islamists'
entry.summary: "Boko Haram elements on Wednesday attacked our forces in Choua," military spokesman Colonel Azem Bermandoa Agouna told AFP, referring to an island on the lake in Chadian territory.

entry.title: Chad says 33 Boko Haram militants, 3 troops killed in clash
Buhari vows intense campaign against Boko Haram
entry.summary: The new president said he would set up a new military command centre in the northeastern city of Maiduguri, the capital of Borno state, which has been a Boko Haram stronghold.

entry.title: Spain charges Boko Haram militant chief with crimes against humanity
entry.summary:
The Boko Haram case arises from a militant attack on the eastern Nigerian town of Ganye on March 22, 2013 in which at least 25 people were killed.

The judge has asked for a study of Boko Haram from Interpol and will obtain a declaration from Mayor about the incident, according to the court papers.

In the Boko Haram case, the state prosecutor used the fact there was a Spanish victim to bring a generic charge of crimes against humanity and terrorism, a court source said.

entry.title: Spain investigates Boko Haram leader on terror charges
entry.summary:
MADRID (AP) - Spain is opening a probe into Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau on suspicion of terrorism and crimes against humanity, under the legal principle of universal justice.

The court ruling asked authorities to locate the nun and requested information on Boko Haram from the United Nations.

entry.title: Nigerian troops kill extremists as militants slay villagers
entry.summary: Meanwhile, farmer Kwada Abawu said he saw at least 10 people slaughtered by Boko Haram fighters before he fled his northeastern village of Kwamda-Kobla on Friday.

entry.title: Hundreds saved from Boko Haram now in military custody
entry.summary:
An intelligence officer told The Associated Press the move followed fears that some women were communicating at night with Boko Haram.

They told The Associated Press heartrending stories of their captivity and the trauma of their rescue from a Sambisa Forest camp, where Boko Haram fighters stoned several of them to death.

entry.title: Hundreds saved from Boko Haram now in military custody
Hundreds saved from Boko Haram put in military custody
entry.summary:
Binta Ibrahim rescued three children aged between 2 and 4 and cared for them during a year of captivity under Boko Haram.

All 275 women, girls and children rescued from Boko Haram were taken into military custody amid suspicions that some are aiding the Islamic extremists.

entry.title: Blast blamed on Boko Haram kills 9, wounds 14 at northeast Nigerian market
entry.summary: It's the latest in a slew of attacks that have occurred since multinational forces broke up Boko Haram's so-called Islamic caliphate by driving the insurgents out of all northeastern towns.

entry.title: Nigerian military: 10 Boko Haram camps destroyed in forest
entry.summary:
One soldier was killed by a land mine when troops overran 10 Boko Haram camps, Olukolade said.

The Defense Ministry has made no comment about the latest Boko Haram surge, which has killed at least 60 civilians in the past 10 days.

entry.title: Boko Haram suicide bomber kills himself, 4 others at Nigerian bus station
Suicide bomber explodes at Nigerian bus station, kills 4
entry.summary: But the Nigerians appear to have bogged down in the Sambisa Forest, where Boko Haram has laid land mines and booby traps.

entry.title: Boko Haram Retakes Nigerian Border Town
entry.summary:
Boko Haram retakes Nigerian border town, attacks villages, plots bombings, official says.

Twenty civilians were killed by the military cannon fire, according to Muhammad Gava, a spokesman for a civilian defense group that fights Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Maiduguri, army repels but hundreds flee
entry.summary: Hundreds of Boko Haram extremists tried to attack the biggest army base in northeast Nigeria overnight but met fierce resistance from soldiers who fired artillery throughout the night.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Maiduguri, army repels but hundreds flee
entry.summary: Tukur Gusau, spokesman for the army's 7th Division that is leading the fight against Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Maiduguri, army repels but hundreds flee
entry.summary:
"Many of them (Boko Haram) were killed outside the trenches while some fled back," said another civilian fighter, Ibrahim Musa.

"We were with the soldiers during the attack and I was shocked to see that Boko Haram could be in such large numbers," Musa told The Associated Press.

Maiduguri has suffered several attacks, including a March 14, 2014 assault in which Boko Haram invaded Giwa Barracks and freed hundreds of detainees.

entry.title: Suspected Boko Haram militants attack Nigeria's Maiduguri
entry.summary: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria, May 13 (Reuters) - Suspected Boko Haram militants attacked Nigeria's northern city of Maiduguri in Borno state on Wednesday from a cashew plantation a few kilometres from the Giwa barracks, military sources said.

entry.title: Suspected Boko Haram militants attack Nigeria's Maiduguri
entry.summary: Boko Haram claimed an area larger than Belgium last year and was fast becoming a regional threat after it increased cross-border incursions.

entry.title: Student Shot in Boko Haram School Attack Dies in Nigeria
entry.summary: One of five students wounded by gunfire in a Boko Haram attack on a school in northeast Nigeria died of his injuries on Monday, the college said.

entry.title: Nigeria, Chad troops should cooperate in Boko Haram fight -Chad's Deby
entry.summary: ABUJA (Reuters) - Chad's President Idriss Deby said on Monday in Nigeria's capital Abuja that the fight against Islamist Boko Haram insurgents was being hindered by failure of the two countries' troops to work together.

entry.title: Only the brave and desperate return to town freed from Boko Haram
entry.summary:
Michika may now be free from Boko Haram but the town in the remote north of Nigeria's Adamawa state is eerily quiet and signs of the militants' presence are everywhere.

The army says it has driven Boko Haram out of Adamawa, spurring many to come back, to assess for the first time the damage to their homes and resume their lives.

entry.title: 3,000 Nigerians escaping Boko Haram deported from Niger
entry.summary: Niger is hosting more than 100,000 other Nigerian refugees who have fled Boko Haram and who apparently are being allowed to remain in camps outside the Lake Chad area.

entry.title: 3,000 Nigerians escaping Boko Haram deported from Niger
entry.summary: On Monday, Niger said it was planning a military operation in the area to rout Boko Haram extremists and ordered its citizens to move further inland.

entry.title: Witnesses: 3,000 Nigerian fishermen, Boko Haram refugees deported from Niger, 12 die in heat
entry.summary: GAIDAM, Nigeria (AP) " Witnesses: 3,000 Nigerian fishermen, Boko Haram refugees deported from Niger, 12 die in heat.

entry.title: Nigerian troops save 25 more kids, women from Boko Haram
entry.summary:
"Our troops are unrelenting in their determined efforts of vanquishing Boko Haram terrorists wherever they are," Usman said.

Most do not know if their husbands and children still are alive or were killed in the attacks when Boko Haram captured them.

entry.title: Boko Haram in disarray as Nigerian forces advance
Nigeria?s Boko Haram in disarray as government forces advance
entry.summary: The army has freed nearly 700 in the past week as it advances on Boko Haram's last stronghold in the vast Sambisa forest.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram in disarray as government forces advance
entry.summary:
The children were left to run around or do errands for Boko Haram while those of the fighters were trained to shoot guns.

"One evening in April, Boko Haram followers stood before us and said 'Our leaders don't want to give us enough fuel and guns and now the soldiers are encroaching on us in Sambisa. We will leave you.'" one of the women, 18-year old Binta Ibrahim from northern Adamawa state said.

Towards evening, as the army approached, the captives refused to flee with Boko Haram fighters, who began stoning them but then ran away.

entry.title: Boko Haram killed victims by stoning and with mines
entry.summary: Even with rescuers near, Boko Haram fighters stoned captives to death, others were crushed by an armored car and three died when a land mine exploded as they walked to freedom.

entry.title: Freed Nigerian women tell of horror of Boko Haram captivity
With rescuers near, girls stoned to death by Boko Haram
entry.summary: A child rescued by Nigerian soldiers waits to receive treatment at a refugee camp in Yola, Nigeria Sunday, May 3, 2015, after being rescued from captivity by Boko Haram fighters.

entry.title: With Rescuers Near, Girls Stoned to Death by Boko Haram
Girls Freed From Boko Haram Extremists Receive Food, Medical Care
entry.summary: Saturday night when the women arrived at the camp, they appeared exhausted and too distressed to realize they were safe, or to be questioned about their experiences under Boko Haram.

entry.title: Nigeria: Nearly 300 freed women, children led to safety
entry.summary:
He lost March 28 elections, in part because of the military failures against Boko Haram and his handling of the hostage situation.

Former military dictator Muhammadu Buhari won the election and has promised to wipe out Boko Haram.

entry.title: Nigeria's military brings first 275 children and women freed from Boko Haram to safety
entry.summary:
They were among a group of 275 children and women rescued from Boko Haram extremists, the first to arrive at a refugee camp Saturday after a three-day journey to safety, brought by Nigeria's military.

Tears came to her eyes when she was asked if she has other children: "Three of them. Boko Haram killed my husband and grabbed me. I have no idea where my other children are."

For nearly a year, Nigeria's President Goodluck Jonathan had been promising to bring home all the people kidnapped by Boko Haram home - especially 219 schoolgirls abducted from their boarding school in the town of Chibok.

The women were exhausted, too traumatized to realize they were safe, or be questioned about their experiences under Boko Haram.

entry.title: Nigeria's offensive against Boko Haram slowed by landmines
entry.summary:
ABUJA, May 2 (Reuters) - Nigeria's military is confident it has Boko Haram cornered, but a final push to clear the Islamist militants from their forest hideouts is being hampered by landmines, it said on Saturday.

Boko Haram grabbed a swathe of Nigeria's northeast bigger than Belgium in 2014 and caused a global outcry when it abducted over 200 schoolgirls from the town of Chibok.

Nigeria launched a ground offensive into Sambisa last month following aerial bombardments and says over 13 Boko Haram camps have since been dismantled.

entry.title: Nigerian military: 234 more girls and women rescued from Boko Haram in forest stronghold
entry.summary:
The Associated Press has reported that some women shot at their rescuers and were killed, with Boko Haram using them as an armed human shield for its main fighting force.

A counselor who has helped rehabilitate other women held captive by Boko Haram told the AP that some identify with the insurgents' extremist ideology after months of captivity and forced marriages.

entry.title: Nigerian military: 234 girls, women rescued from extremists
entry.summary: LAGOS, Nigeria (AP) - Nigeria's military has rescued 234 more girls and women from a Boko Haram forest stronghold in the country's northeast, an announcement on social media said Saturday.

entry.title: Nigerian army rescues 234 girls
entry.summary: It is not known how many girls, women, boys and men Boko Haram has kidnapped over its six-year-old rebellion.

entry.title: Niger Governor Orders Evacuations Due to Boko Haram
Niger islands evacuated after Boko Haram attacks
entry.summary: Niamey: A regional governor in southern Niger has ordered the evacuation of the West African nation's inhabited islands on Lake Chad following a deadly attack there by Boko Haram militants last week.

entry.title: Scores more women, girls freed in Nigeria from Boko Haram
entry.summary: Some of the women and girls are pregnant, according to Muhammad Gavi, a spokesman for a self-defense group that fights Boko Haram who said some members have seen the females.

entry.title: More women and children freed from Boko Haram in Nigeria
entry.summary:
The army spokesman said several Boko Haram field commanders and foot soldiers were killed and combat tanks and munitions of high caliber used by Boko Haram were recovered while others were destroyed.

Their kidnapping brought Boko Haram, whose nickname means "Western education is forbidden" in the local Hausa language, to the world's attention.

entry.title: Nigerian military rescues more women, girls from Boko Haram
entry.summary:
Nigerian troops have rescued about 160 more hostages from Boko Haram's Sambisa Forest stronghold, the army said on Thursday, taking the total number liberated this week alone to nearly 500.

On Thursday, Usman said about 160 more hostages were freed in an operation involving troops from the army's 7th Division, which has been tasked with fighting Boko Haram.

entry.title: Girls, Women Rescued From Boko Haram Need Psychological Care
entry.summary: Some of the nearly 300 girls and women freed by Nigeria's military from the forest stronghold of Boko Haram were so transformed by their captivity that they opened fire on their rescuers, and experts said Wednesday they would need intensive psychological treatment.

entry.title: Girls, women rescued from Boko Haram need psychological care
Nigerian military evacuating girls, women rescued from Boko Haram
entry.summary: The government of neighboring Niger said a Boko Haram attack on Karamga island in Lake Chad over the weekend killed 156 militants, 46 soldiers and 28 civilians.

entry.title: Girls, women rescued from Boko Haram need psychological care
entry.summary: Boko Haram continues to attack isolated communities.

entry.title: Nigerian military evacuating, evaluating 293 girls and women rescued from Boko Haram forest
Military evaluating girls, women rescued from Boko Haram forest
entry.summary:
Usman said military operations continue in the forest where the women and girls were rescued while troops destroyed four Boko Haram camps.

Scores of abducted girls, women and men have been freed or escaped from Boko Haram in the process.

entry.title: Nigerian military evacuating, evaluating 293 girls and women rescued from Boko Haram forest
entry.summary: An intelligence officer and a soldier say Boko Haram used some of the women as armed human shields, a first line of defense who fired at troops.

entry.title: Nigeria army rescues nearly 300 females from Boko Haram
entry.summary: Many have escaped or been released as Boko Haram has fled a multinational offensive that began at the end of January.

entry.title: Nigerian army rescues 300 women and girls, none from Chibok
entry.summary:
Their kidnapping brought Boko Haram to the attention of the world, with even U.S. first lady Michelle Obama becoming involved as she tweeted a photograph of herself holding the campaign sign.

Boko Haram also has used girls and women as suicide bombers, sending them into crowded market places and elsewhere.

entry.title: Nigerian army says it has rescued 200 girls, 93 women from Boko Haram but not the Chibok girls
entry.summary: Boko Haram has kidnapped an unknown number of girls, women and young men to be used as sex slaves and fighters.

entry.title: Boko Haram battle: Nigerian army rescues 200 girls, 93 women
entry.summary:
Abuja: Nigeria's military is claiming the rescue of 200 girls and 93 women from a notorious Boko Haram stronghold, but there is no confirmation the hostages are those kidnapped from Chibok a year ago.

But Boko Haram has also been blamed for hundreds of other kidnappings, especially targeting women and girls across northeast Nigeria.

entry.title: Nigerian army says it has rescued hundreds of girls from Boko Haram
entry.summary: Nigeria's army has rescued 200 girls and 93 women during a military operation to wrest back the Sambisa Forest from the Boko Haram Islamist militant group, it said on Tuesday.

entry.title: Nigeria Says It Rescued Hundreds Of Women And Girls From Boko Haram Stronghold
entry.summary: Boko Haram kidnapped more than 200 schoolgirls near the northern village of Chibok in April 2014, sparking international outcry.

entry.title: Niger Army Retakes Control of Island From Boko Haram
Niger army retakes control of island from Boko Haram
entry.summary: Military forces started retaking towns in February from Boko Haram, whose fighters had months of gains.

entry.title: Dozens of soldiers, civilians killed in fresh Boko Haram violence

entry.summary: Gujba is one of a handful of districts in Yobe that Boko Haram captured during its sweeping offensive last year.

entry.title: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen kill 21 in NE Nigeria: official, relative
entry.summary: "The men, 21 of them, were stopped at Bultaram (village) by gunmen we believe are Boko Haram who shot them dead," said Baba Nuhu, an official with the Gujba local government in Yobe state.

entry.title: Boko Haram kill 21 civilians in northeast Nigeria
entry.summary: Suspected Boko Haram gunmen have shot dead 21 people in northeast Nigeria who were trying to return home to recover abandoned supplies, a local official and a victim's relative said.

entry.title: Niger army fights Boko Haram for Lake Chad island after attack
entry.summary: Boko Haram, hardline Islamists who want to establish a caliphate in the region, attacked the island of Karamga at dawn on Saturday, their second attempt to capture it since February, army and government sources said.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Niger army base, defense ministry says
entry.summary:
A similar attack on Karamga Island in February killed seven Niger soldiers, and 14 Boko Haram fighters were also killed, military officials said at the time.

Niger joined a regional offensive earlier this year that is credited with retaking large swaths of territory in Nigeria from Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram Attacks Niger Army Base, Defense Ministry Says
entry.summary: It said operations are ongoing "with the help of allies" to defeat Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Niger army base, defense ministry says
entry.summary: NIAMEY, Niger (AP) - Niger's defense ministry says suspected Boko Haram fighters attacked an army base on the island of Karamga in Lake Chad.

entry.title: Boko Haram retakes NE town from Nigerian army
entry.summary: A senior military official confirmed the attack on Marte, but refused to say whether Boko Haram had retaken the town, describing the army's retreat as "strategic".

entry.title: Nigerian troops forced to retreat from mined Boko Haram stronghold
entry.summary: "All their fighters who were pushed out of Bama, Dikwa, Gwoza and Damboa (in Borno state) all moved to Boko Haram camps in Sambisa," he added.

entry.title: Nigerian forces invade last known stronghold of Boko Haram
entry.summary: The Sambisa forest in northeast Nigeria is about 100 km (60 miles) from the village of Chibok from where Boko Haram abducted more than 200 secondary school girls a year ago.

entry.title: Boko Haram Cameroon attack toll rises to 19, 'many beheaded'
entry.summary:
Nineteen people were killed in Thursday night's attack on a Cameroonian village by Nigeria-based Boko Haram militants, a security source said in an updated toll, adding that most of the victims were beheaded.

Also during the night from Thursday to Friday, Boko Haram Islamists attacked a Cameroon army position in Amchide, on the border with Nigeria.

entry.title: Boko Haram slit throats of 12 as army tries to save civilians - sources
entry.summary:
The town of Gwoza, in mountainous terrain, was one of the last places to fall, on March 27, and there remain pockets of Boko Haram activity in the area, security sources say.

Failure to crush Boko Haram or protect civilians was one reason President Goodluck Jonathan lost an election on March 28 to Muhammadu Buhari.

entry.title: Boko Haram slit throats of 12 as army tries to save civilians: sources
entry.summary:
MAIDUGURI, Nigeria (Reuters) - Boko Haram militants have slit the throats of 12 people in northeast Nigeria as the army was trying to evacuate civilians from the area, a military source and a witness said on Friday.

"Just as troops were trying to evacuate some civilians from the hills so as to safeguard them from a planned air strike ... some Boko Haram attacked them and slit the throats of 12 people," a military source said of Wednesday's attack.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks 2 villages in Cameroon, kills 12
CORRECTION: Boko Haram-UN story
Boko Haram militants kill at least 10 in north Cameroon
entry.summary:
Fighters from Islamist group Boko Haram killed at least ten people in overnight attacks on two villages in northern Cameroon, two senior army sources told Reuters on Friday.

"There were consecutive attacks by Boko Haram in Bia and Blaberi in the district of Kolofata in the early morning," said one officer, who asked not to be named.

entry.title: Nigerian Leader to UN: No Need for International Force
entry.summary: In a story April 16 about negotiations for a U.N. mandate for a multination force to fight Boko Haram, The Associated Press incorrectly stated that a Chapter 7 mandate requires military enforcement.

entry.title: Nigerian leader to UN: No need for international force
entry.summary:
Chad began the offensive at the end of January and Nigerian security forces announced this week that they have driven Boko Haram from all major northeastern towns and communities except a forest stronghold.

Boko Haram was little known outside the region until its mass abduction a year ago of nearly 300 schoolgirls that outraged the world.

entry.title: Nigerian leader to UN: No need for international force
entry.summary: Nigeria's outgoing president told the United Nations on Thursday not to focus on deploying an international force to fight Boko Haram but instead help victims of its terror.

entry.title: Raw: Silent protest against Boko Haram
2014 saw use of rape, sexual slavery by extremist groups like Islamic State and Boko Haram: UN report
entry.summary: Secretary-General Ban Ki-moon said 2014 was marked by harrowing accounts of rape, sexual slavery and forced marriage being used by extremists including the Islamic State group and Boko Haram.

entry.title: UN report: 2014 saw extremists use rape, sexual slavery
entry.summary: "Forced marriage, enslavement and the 'sale' of kidnapped women and girls are central to Boko Haram's modus operandi and ideology," it said.

entry.title: Nigeria marks first anniversary of Boko Haram schoolgirl kidnappings
Nigeria marks 1st anniversary of Boko Haram schoolgirl kidnappings
entry.summary:
Nigeria on Tuesday marks the first anniversary of Boko Haram's abduction of 219 schoolgirls from the northeastern town of Chibok, as part of a series of events planned around the world.

Boko Haram fighters stormed the Government Secondary School in the remote town in Borno state on the evening of April 14 last year, seizing 276 girls who were preparing for end-of-year exams.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram abducted 2,000 women and girls: report

entry.title: At least 2,000 women and girls kidnapped by Boko Haram: Amnesty
entry.summary: Boko Haram has kidnapped at least 2,000 women and girls since the beginning of last year, Amnesty International said on Tuesday, a year on from the mass abduction of 219 Nigerian schoolgirls.

entry.title: 800,000 children forced from homes in Boko Haram violence
entry.summary: They became separated when Boko Haram attacked the Nigerian town of Baga, and she knows how worried they must be.

entry.title: 800,000 children forced from homes in Boko Haram violence

Boko Haram's nearly 6-year-old Islamic uprising in northeast Nigeria that has killed thousands a reported 10,000 just last year and forced more than 1.5 million from their homes.

entry.title: 800,000 children forced from homes by Boko Haram suffer abuse: UNICEF
entry.summary: The disturbing images come from some of an estimated 800,000 children forced from the homes by Boko Haram extremists, according to a UNICEF report published Monday.

entry.title: 800,000 children forced from homes in Boko Haram violence
entry.summary: Children account for about half of all the 1.5 million made homeless in the Boko Haram conflict that has spilled across the borders of northeast Nigeria.

entry.title: Nigeria girls who fled Boko Haram look to brighter future
entry.summary:
Boko Haram fighters stormed the school after sundown, kidnapping 276 girls.

Deborah and 20 other girls from Chibok who escaped Boko Haram captivity are now studying at the American University of Nigeria (AUN) in the northeastern city of Yola.

entry.title: 71 Chadian soldiers killed fighting Boko Haram: army
entry.summary:
Seventy-one Chadian soldiers have been killed and 416 wounded in less than three months of fighting in the regional campaign to crush the Boko Haram insurgency, Chad's army said Friday.

"They (troops) have liberated 11 communities in Cameroon, Niger and Nigeria from the hands of Boko Haram," said Seid.

entry.title: Boko Haram, ousted from towns and camps, still killing
entry.summary: In this photo taken Wednesday, April 8, 2015, a woman walks past Nigerian Soldiers at a checkpoint in Gwoza, Nigeria, a town newly liberated from Boko Haram.

entry.title: Boko Haram, ousted from towns and camps, still killing
entry.summary: Olukolade did not respond directly to questions about border towns that have been seized by Chadian troops who then withdraw, leaving Boko Haram to return.

entry.title: Boko Haram, ousted from towns and camps, still killing
entry.summary:
It was a chilling reminder that Boko Haram extremists still are in northeast Nigeria with all sorts of weapons even as Nigeria's military officials boast that they have ousted them from all major towns and forest camps.

Boko Haram has been left "marauding from place to place," he told The Associated Press.

entry.title: U.N. seeks $174 mln to support refugees fleeing Boko Haram
entry.summary: "Boko Haram has been so vicious in targeting civilians that there is a psychosis among the refugees," said Robert Piper, the U.N.'s Regional Humanitarian Coordinator for the Sahel region.

entry.title: U.N. seeks $174 million to support refugees fleeing Boko Haram
entry.summary: In addition to the refugees, there are more than 1.1 million people displaced within northeast Nigeria by Boko Haram, the U.N. says.

entry.title: UN in $174 mn appeal for Nigeria's Boko Haram refugees
entry.summary: Nigeria, Chad, Niger and Cameroon last month launched an unprecedented joint campaign against Boko Haram after the militants widened their offensive with attacks in the neighbouring countries.

entry.title: Boko Haram disguised as preachers kill at least 24 in Nigeria
entry.summary:
Islamist Boko Haram militants disguised as preachers killed at least 24 people and wounded several others in an attack near a mosque in northeast Nigeria's Borno state, a military source and witness said on Monday.

"People didn't know the Boko Haram men came for attack because they lied to our people that they came for preaching," said Buba in a telephone conversation.

entry.title: Boko Haram disguised as preachers kill at least 24 in Nigeria
African leaders to meet in bid to crush Boko Haram
entry.summary: A coalition involving troops from the four countries has been battling the Islamists in a bid to crush the insurgency, which has now spread across borders from Boko Haram's stronghold in northern Nigeria.

entry.title: African leaders to hold Boko Haram summit April 8
entry.summary: It will be the first meeting of its kind since Nigeria's election a week ago which was won by Muhammadu Buhari, a former military leader who has vowed to rid his country of the "terror" of Boko Haram.

entry.title: African leaders to hold Boko Haram summit on April 8
entry.summary: Leaders of central and west African states will hold a summit on April 8 to try to draw up a joint strategy against the threat posed by Boko Haram militants.

entry.title: Boko Haram kill four in Nigeria village raid
entry.summary: KANO (Nigeria): At least four people were killed when suspected Boko Haram fighters raided a local market in a village near the northeast Nigerian city of Maiduguri, security sources said.

entry.title: Niger President: Boko Haram, 'Islam's worst enemy,' will be beaten
entry.summary:
"There is nothing Islamic about Boko Haram," Issoufou told students and faculty at the Harvard Institute of Politics John F. Kennedy Forum in Cambridge, Massachusetts, during a trip to the United States.

"Boko Haram has no future, Boko Haram will be defeated, God willing."

entry.title: Boko Haram, 'Islam's worst enemy,' will be beaten: Niger president
entry.summary: "It shows the population of our countries reject terrorism, reject extremism. The population of our countries reject Boko Haram as a Muslim organization," he said.

entry.title: Boko Haram uses children as human bombs, commits 'heinous crimes': UN
entry.summary: Boko Haram has been attacking towns and villages in northern Nigeria and border regions of neighbouring Cameroon, Chad and Niger.

entry.title: Nigerian election winner vows to crush Boko Haram insurgency
entry.summary: "I assure you that Boko Haram will soon know the strength of our collective will and commitment to rid this nation of terror and bring back peace," Buhari said.

entry.title: Chad says hundreds of Boko Haram militants, 9 soldiers killed in clash
entry.summary: "There was fighting and we recorded nine dead and 16 injured. There were hundreds of dead on Boko Haram's side," said Colonel Azem Bermandoa, a spokesman for Chad's army.

entry.title: Chad says hundreds of Boko Haram militants, nine soldiers killed in clash
entry.summary: N'DJAMENA (Reuters) - Chad's army said its forces had killed hundreds of Boko Haram militants and lost nine of its own troops in clashes in northern Nigeria on Wednesday.

entry.title: Nigeria's Buhari says to "spare no effort" in fighting Boko Haram
entry.summary: "Boko Haram will soon know the strength of our collective will. We should spare no effort," Buhari said in his first formal speech since winning the election.

entry.title: UN rights chief: Boko Haram fighters murdered captive women
Niger: Troops prevent Boko Haram attack, destroy base
entry.summary: NIAMEY, Niger (AP) - Soldiers fended off an attack on a border town in Niger by Boko Haram and destroyed a base used by the Islamic militants inside neighboring Nigeria in recent days, Niger said Tuesday.

entry.title: Niger: Troops prevent Boko Haram attack, destroy base
Boko Haram failed to disrupt Nigeria elections: UN
entry.summary: Boko Haram was unable to disrupt elections in Nigeria but its allegiance to Islamic State shows the group has an agenda that reaches well beyond Africa's most populous country, a UN envoy said Monday.

entry.title: Eight suspected Boko Haram gunmen killed in NE Nigeria: residents
entry.summary: Eight suspected Boko Haram fighters were killed on Monday during fighting in Gombe and Bauchi states, northeast Nigeria, police, residents and local hunters said.

entry.title: Nigerian military claim to destroy Boko Haram headquarters
entry.summary: The forest starts about 30 kilometers (20 miles) from Gwoza town, which is 130 kilometers (80 miles) southeast of Maiduguri, the capital of Borno state and birthplace of Boko Haram.

entry.title: Nigerian military claim to destroy Boko Haram headquarters
entry.summary: Nigeria's military, with support of troops and military aircraft from neighboring countries, in the past two months has retaken dozens of towns from Boko Haram.

entry.title: Nigerian military claim to destroy Boko Haram headquarters

entry.summary: Despite the military muscle, many of those who fled Boko Haram attacks are reluctant to return home.

entry.title: In shadow of Boko Haram, Cameroon combats extremism at home
entry.summary:
In recent months, Cameroon has arrested dozens of imams and their followers accused of promoting radical ideology and collaborating with Nigeria's Boko Haram militants.

Military operations alone cannot defeat Boko Haram, says Bridgit Ndemba, a sociologist at the University of Yaounde, in the capital.

entry.title: Boko Haram using civilians as human shields, Nigerian official says

Instead, he said that as troops advanced, Boko Haram rushed to a school where people had been held after the insurgents had seized the town late last year.

Boko Haram has killed thousands of civilians and kidnapped unknown hundreds in its fight to create an Islamic state.

entry.title: Official: Boko Haram kidnaps hundreds of Nigerian civilians
entry.summary: When troops from Chad and Niger advanced toward Damasak, Boko Haram began taking captives, said Omeri.

entry.title: Boko Haram Kidnaps Hundreds of Nigerian Civilians
entry.summary: Troops from Chad and Niger recaptured Damasak, near the border with Niger, from Boko Haram on March 16.

entry.title: Official: Boko Haram abducts hundreds of Nigerian civilians
entry.summary: ABUJA, Nigeria (AP) - Hundreds of civilians, including many children, have been abducted and are being used as human shields by Boko Haram extremists, a top Nigerian official confirmed Wednesday.

entry.title: Boko Haram kidnapped hundreds in northern Nigeria town, residents say
entry.summary: Boko Haram's abduction last April of nearly 300 schoolgirls in the region stirred international outrage and drew global attention to the group's six-year insurgency.

entry.title: Boko Haram kidnapped hundreds in northern Nigeria town
entry.summary: Boko Haram wants to carve out a caliphate in northern Nigeria and a sharp increase in violence forced a delay in planned elections last month in Africa's most populous country.

entry.title: Boko Haram kidnapped hundreds in northern Nigeria town
entry.summary: DAMASAK, Nigeria - Boko Haram militants have kidnapped more than 400 women and children from the northern Nigerian town of Damasak that was freed this month by troops from Niger and Chad, residents said on Tuesday.

entry.title: Displaced fear Boko Haram violence as elections approach
entry.summary:
Boko Haram appears to have been weakened by a sustained regional fight-back, but there are growing fears the group could target vulnerable people displaced by the violence as elections approach.

Now, it is feared that internally displaced people (IDP) could be next, after Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau vowed to disrupt this Saturday's elections, which the group views as "un-Islamic".

entry.title: Retreating Boko Haram leaves mass of throat-slit corpses near Nigerian town
Boko Haram 'slaughter wives' in Nigeria
entry.summary:
Maiduguri: Dozens of Nigerian women who were forced to marry Boko Haram fighters have reportedly been slaughtered by their "husbands" before a battle with troops in the northeast town of Bama.

Boko Haram forcibly married scores of women in Bama after seizing it in September.

entry.title: Niger troops say find mass grave outside town taken from Boko Haram
entry.summary: "Niger and Chad's troops have discovered a mass grave at Damasak, which appears to contain the bodies of Boko Haram's victims," said one of the military sources, who asked not to be identified.

entry.title: We will eradicate Boko Haram within a months, says Nigeria president
entry.summary:
The Nigeria Security Network of analysts on Thursday meanwhile warned that Boko Haram would revert to its guerrilla campaign of bombings and suicide attacks in the face of military pressure.

Fears remain about the safety of voters on polling day, after a spate of suicide attacks in the north in recent weeks and after Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau vowed to disrupt the election.

entry.title: Boko Haram 'getting weaker every day', says Nigeria president
entry.summary:
The Nigerian president has said the military hopes to recapture towns seized by Boko Haram within a month, in what would be a swift victory after six years of bloody conflict.

Goodluck Jonathan, who is seeking re-election on 28 March, said Boko Haram was "getting weaker and weaker every day".

A Boko Haram attack on the border town of Gamboru on Wednesday and Thursday killed 11 civilians and gave an indication of the difficulties in bringing a definitive end to the violence.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks liberated Nigerian town, kills 11
entry.summary: It was the first reported attack on a town previously occupied by Boko Haram since a regional offensive was launched by troops from Chad seven weeks ago.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigerian town, kills 11
entry.summary: BAUCHI, Nigeria (AP) - Boko Haram extremists have attacked on a Nigerian border town, killing 11 people who had recently come home after military forces ousted the insurgents, witnesses said.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigerian town, kills 11
entry.summary: Nigeria says the multinational push aims to eradicate Boko Haram.

entry.title: African troops' morale 'sky high' as they push back Boko Haram
Boko Haram attacks Nigeria's Gamboru, women slaughtered in Bama
entry.summary: According to Bakura's account, which was supported by others, Boko Haram fighters received word of a military assault on Bama, formerly an Islamist stronghold in Borno state.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Nigeria town of Gamboru, kills 11: witnesses
entry.summary: Boko Haram militants killed 11 people in an attack on Gamboru, northeast Nigeria, as hundreds of Islamists flooded the town following the withdrawal of Chadian troops, witnesses said Thursday.

entry.title: Proposed UN resolution would endorse military action by an African force against Boko Haram
entry.summary:
UNITED NATIONS - Chad has circulated a draft resolution to the U.N. Security Council that would endorse military action by a five-nation African force against Nigeria's Islamic extremist group Boko Haram.

The draft resolution expresses "deep concern" that Boko Haram recently pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group.

entry.title: UN seeks to endorse military action against Boko Haram
entry.summary: Boko Haram is already subject to U.N. sanctions.

entry.title: Nigerian military: No news of 219 kidnapped schoolgirls
entry.summary:
The admission of lack of progress on the missing schoolgirls comes as the Nigerian military, bolstered by forces from neighboring countries, is regaining towns and cities held by Boko Haram in northeastern Nigeria.

"We are optimistic that ... we will get further details on them" as Boko Haram's area of influence shrinks, Minimah said in Abuja, Nigeria's capital.

He said Boko Haram now holds only three of 27 local government areas in Borno, the third northeastern state under a military state of emergency and the birthplace of Boko Haram.

entry.title: Nigerian military: No news of 219 kidnapped schoolgirls
entry.summary: LAGOS, Nigeria (AP) - Nigeria's military says it has no news of the more than 200 schoolgirls kidnapped by Islamic extremists nearly a year ago, despite liberating dozens of towns from the girls' Boko Haram abductors.

entry.title: Nigeria says it has pushed Boko Haram out of all but 3 areas
entry.summary: At the start of this year, Boko Haram controlled around 20 local government areas, a territory the size of Belgium, in its bloody six-year-old campaign to carve out an Islamic state in religiously mixed Nigeria.

entry.title: Nigeria says has pushed Boko Haram out of all but three areas
entry.summary: ABUJA (Reuters) - The Nigerian army said on Tuesday it had repelled Boko Haram from all but three local government districts in the northeast, claiming victory for its offensive against the Islamist insurgents less than two weeks before a presidential election.

entry.title: Nigeria begins 'final onslaught' against Boko Haram: govt
entry.summary: Nigeria has begun the "final onslaught" against Boko Haram, the country's national security spokesman said on Tuesday, after the militants were ousted from the strategic town of Bama.

entry.title: Pope hails bravery of Nigeria priests against Boko Haram
entry.summary: Pope Francis on Tuesday hailed the bravery of Nigerian priests who have stood strong in the face of Boko Haram violence and worked to build bridges with the Muslim community.

entry.title: Foreigners train Nigerian troops as "final onslaught" hits Boko Haram
entry.summary: Africa's most populous nation and top energy producer has been plagued by the Boko Haram insurgency since 2009, when insurgents intensified efforts to establish an Islamic caliphate in the northeastern Borno state.

entry.title: Nigerian, Cameroon troops oust Boko Haram from town, village
entry.summary: Jacob Kodji said forces from his country attacked Boko Haram militants from Borno state's Ndaba village on Thursday and Friday, killing several of the extremists and destroying some of their vehicles and ammunition.

entry.title: Cameroon says 25 Boko Haram suspects died in custody
entry.summary:
Boko Haram has been fighting a nearly 6-year insurgency against the Nigerian government, killing thousands and carrying out mass kidnappings, including of schoolgirls.

Cameroon's northern region was repeatedly targeted by Boko Haram before the country signed up to participate in a multinational force that has dislodged the group from a score of northeastern Nigerian towns in recent weeks.

entry.title: Cameroon says 25 Boko Haram suspects died in custody
entry.summary: Nigeria acknowledged on Thursday that it is getting help from regional security operatives amid reports that South Africa and other foreign contractors are involved in the fight against Boko Haram.

entry.title: France increases its efforts in the fight against Boko Haram
entry.summary: The operation to fight Boko Haram is "flexible," which means that some troops can be redeployed from one country to another, one of the officials said without giving more details.

entry.title: France Increases Its Efforts in the Fight Against Boko Haram
entry.summary:
France has reoriented its military efforts in West Africa to focus more on the fight against Boko Haram, especially by providing intelligence to the African countries that are at war against the extremist movement.

France supports the offensive led by Chad in cooperation with Cameroon, Niger and Nigeria - Boko Haram's base.

France's defense minister said this week that the country would "slightly" increase its number of troops in the Sahel region by the end of the year, but does not intend to take active part in the fighting against Boko Haram.

entry.title: Islamic State group accepts Boko Haram pledge of allegiance
entry.summary: BEIRUT (AP) - Islamic State militants have accepted a pledge of allegiance by the Nigerian-grown Boko Haram extremist group, according to a spokesman for the Islamic State movement.

entry.title: IS accepts Boko Haram pledge of allegiance
Boko Haram is said to have pledged allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
If confirmed, the pledge would make the group, Boko Haram, which is believed to have as many as 6,000 fighters, the largest extremist group to date to agree to fight under the Islamic State banner, analysts said.

In the message published on his Twitter account on Saturday, Abubakar Shekau, Boko Haram's leader, announced that he had sworn allegiance to the Islamic State, also known as ISIS.

Terrorism experts say that the pledge, or "bayat", is a spiritually binding oath, and it indicates that Boko Haram's leader agrees to be under the authority of the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: The pledge to Islamic State came in an Arabic audio message with English subtitles alleged to have come from Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau and posted on Twitter, according to the SITE Intelligence monitoring service.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria (AP) - Nigeria's home-grown Boko Haram group, newly weakened by a multinational force that has dislodged it from a score of northeastern towns, reportedly pledged formal allegiance to the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Now ISIS takes a terrifying stranglehold on Nigeria after Boko Haram releases audio recording pledging allegiance to the terror group?

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram pledges allegiance to Islamic State
entry.summary:
Boko Haram has killed thousands and kidnapped hundreds during its six-year campaign to carve out an Islamist state in northern Nigeria.

The pledge of allegiance was attributed to Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau.

entry.title: Lakeside communities in Chad live in fear of Boko Haram

"The Boko Haram are against Islam."

entry.title: Lakeside communities in Chad live in fear of Boko Haram
entry.summary: "I never thought Boko Haram would come here, and now we are afraid that they will come back. They must be eliminated."

entry.title: Residents: Boko Haram readies for battle in NE Nigeria
entry.summary: An intelligence officer said security forces are moving slowly for fear of harming civilians, and especially since Boko Haram is surrounding Gwoza with land mines.

entry.title: Residents: Boko Haram readies for battle in NE Nigeria
entry.summary: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria (AP) - Boko Haram fighters are massing at their headquarters in the northeast Nigerian town of Gwoza in preparation for a showdown with multinational forces, residents and an intelligence officer said.

entry.title: Boko Haram refugees risk lives to cross lake to Chad camps
entry.summary:
Officials say that several thousand had arrived in Chad by the end of 2015 as Boko Haram intensified its attacks in the area.

Nigerians who fled Boko Haram to Chad sit outside their tent at the Baga Solo refugee camp in Chad, Wednesday March 4, 2015.

entry.title: Boko Haram killing men, tribes linked to Chad, witnesses say
entry.summary: "They gathered the people in the market, and then separated the Kanuris from the Shuwa Arabs; then they informed the Shuwa Arabs that it was your tribesmen of Chad that are tormenting (Boko Haram)," he said.

entry.title: Boko Haram refugees risk lives to cross lake to Chad camps
entry.summary: "If I had stayed there they would have killed me too," she said softly inside a tent at a refugee camp now home to more than 6,000 Nigerians who have fled Boko Haram's violence.

entry.title: Refugees flee Boko Haram violence in Nigeria by boat as jihadist group steps up violence
entry.summary: It was one of the worst massacres ever carried out by Boko Haram during its five-year insurgency.

entry.title: Chad president tells Boko Haram leader to surrender or face death
entry.summary:
N'DJAMENA - President Idriss Deby of Chad said on Wednesday he knew the whereabouts of Abubakar Shekau, the leader of the Nigerian militant group Boko Haram, and called on him to surrender or risk being killed.

"He was in Dikwa two days ago. He managed to get away but we know where he is. It's in his interests to surrender," Deby said, referring to a town in northeastern Nigeria held by Boko Haram that fell to Chad's army earlier this week.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: The group previously had links to al Qaeda and though Boko Haram and IS have acknowledged each other, the Nigerian militants have not officially pledged allegiance to IS leader Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi.

entry.title: Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing IS
entry.summary: The Boko Haram film's use of graphics, the footage of black-clad militants with a black flag, and the editing to show only the aftermath of the beheading, were particularly reminiscent of footage from IS, which has seized large parts of Iraq and Syria and killed several hostages.

entry.title: Boko Haram beheadings video echoes Isis techniques
entry.summary: The Nigerian Islamist sect Boko Haram has released a video that purportedly shows militants beheading two men, its first online posting using the advanced graphics and editing techniques associated with Islamic State.

entry.title: Nigeria?s Boko Haram releases beheading video echoing Islamic State
entry.summary: Nigeria's President Goodluck Jonathan has said Boko Haram is allied to both al Qaeda and its offshoot Islamic State, though that has not been confirmed by the group itself.

entry.title: Boko Haram video shows 2 beheaded men accused of spying

entry.title: New Boko Haram Video Appears To Show Two Captives Beheaded

Boko Haram has said in social media messages last month that it is considering swearing allegiance to IS.

entry.title: Boko Haram video shows 2 beheaded men accused of spying
entry.summary:
MAIDUGURI, Nigeria (AP) - The latest video from Nigeria's Boko Haram Islamic extremist group shows the bodies of two beheaded men accused of spying, and copies some of the hallmarks of propaganda from the Islamic State group.

Boko Haram began emulating the Islamic State group last August, declaring it had established an Islamic caliphate in territory it controls in northeastern Nigeria.

entry.title: Boko Haram kill villagers after fleeing offensive
Nigerian planes bomb Boko Haram camps, military says
entry.summary:

Sambisa gained notoriety last year when more than 200 girls kidnapped by Boko Haram from a secondary school in nearby Chibok were taken there.

entry.title: Nigerian army says 300 Boko Haram militants killed
entry.summary: The military says it's killed 300 Boko Haram fighters in an operation to recapture 11 towns and villages.

entry.title: US launches Africa military exercises amid Boko Haram threat
entry.summary:
Now the most imminent danger to regional security is Boko Haram, which killed at least 10,000 people in Nigeria last year and is now staging cross-border attacks in Cameroon, Niger and Chad.

While the upcoming multinational force against Boko Haram is not a specific focus of Flintlock, the training is aimed at broader themes that will apply to that mission.

entry.title: US launches Africa military exercises amid Boko Haram threat

entry.summary: Boko Haram's Islamic extremist insurgency killed 10,000 people last year, according to the U.S. Council on Foreign Relations.

entry.summary: The Associated Press obtained a copy of the message in which Boko Haram warned that its fighters will attack all polling stations in the March 28 elections.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Chad village as revolt spreads
entry.summary: A video still shows Boko Haram leader Abubakar Shekau speaking to the camera.

entry.title: Girl who escaped Boko Haram reveals Chibok kidnapping inspired them
entry.summary: Ngouboua is already home to nearly 3,300 refugees who had fled the Boko Haram-related violence back home in Nigeria, according to the United Nations.

entry.title: Boko Haram Launches First Attack on Chadian Village
entry.summary:
Boko Haram has threated any nation contributing to the fight against them.

Chad, Niger, Cameroon and Benin all have pledged to send military support though Chadian soldiers are already fighting Boko Haram militants inside Cameroon and Nigeria.

The multinational force to fight Boko Haram is expected to be formally launched in coming weeks.

entry.title: Nigeria's Boko Haram launches first attack in Chad
entry.summary: Dozens of Boko Haram fighters arrived in the early hours of the morning on motorized canoes at the fishing village on the shores of Lake Chad, setting houses ablaze and attacking a police station.

entry.title: Boko Haram stages first attack on Chad
Boko Haram attacks Chadian village as revolt spreads
entry.summary:
In a bid to contain Boko Haram, which has killed thousands and kidnapped hundreds in its five-year revolt, President Idriss Deby's government mediated peace talks between the Nigerian government and the group last October.

The talks sought to secure the release of 200 schoolgirls from Nigeria's Chibok but Boko Haram later said it had married off the schoolgirls to its fighters.

entry.title: Boko Haram attacks Chadian village as revolt spreads
entry.summary: Nigeria has postponed for six weeks a presidential election that had been due on Saturday, citing the security threat from Boko Haram.
